title: SUPER Schema 5b2
description: Schema Preference settings for S.U.P.E.R.M.A.N. update script [com.macjutsu.super]. This will support macOS 15; Sequoia. This has been modified by Zachary 'Woznicki'. Last update: 8/5/24/.

AuthJamfComputerID.title: Auth Jamf Computer ID
AuthJamfComputerID.description: Use this when using super with Jamf Pro API account.

DeferralTimerDefault.title: Default Defer Timer
DeferralTimerDefault.description: The number of minutes to defer until the next update attempt if a user chooses not to update restart. It must be between 2 and 1440. Default deferral time is 60. Put X to diasble this option.

DeferralTimerFocus.title: Focus Defer Timer
DeferralTimerFocus.description: The number of minutes to defer the update restart dialog automatically if a process has prevented display sleep (for example, during an active meeting) or the user has Focus or Do Not Disturb enabled. It must be between 2 and 1440. Put X to diasble this option.

DeferralTimerMenu.title: Menu Defer Timer
DeferralTimerMenu.description: Display a deferral time pop-up menu in the non-deadline update restart dialog that allows the user to overide the DeferralTimerDefault time. It must be between 2 and 1440. Put X to diable this option.

DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.title: Workflow Relaunch Defer Timer
DeferralTimerWorkflowRelaunch.description: The number of minutes to defer if no software updates are found. It must be between 2 and 43804. Put X to diable this option.

DeferralTimerError.title: Error Defer Timer
DeferralTimerError.description: The number of minutes to defer if super detects an error in the workflow (for example, network or MDM connectivity issues). It must be between 2 and 1440. Default deferral time is 60. Put X to diasble this option.

DeadlineCountFocus.title: Focus Count Deadline
DeadlineCountFocus.description: The maximum number of automatic deferrals allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineCountSoft.title: Soft Count Deadline
DeadlineCountSoft.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the soft deadline automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineCountHard.title: Hard Count Deadline
DeadlineCountHard.description: The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysFocus.title: Focus Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysFocus.description: The maximum number of days that automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysSoft.title: Soft Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysSoft.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the soft deadline dialog. The soft deadline is an interactive update restart dialog indicating that no more deferrals are allowed. Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDaysHard.title: Hard Days Deadline
DeadlineDaysHard.description: The maximum number of days allowed before the computer automatically restarts for updates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

ScheduleZeroDateManual.title: Zero Day Workflow Date
ScheduleZeroDateManual.description: Instead of having the days deadline counter, automatically select the day zero date. PutX to diable this option.

DeadlineDateFocus.title: Focus Date Deadline
DeadlineDateFocus.description: This is the last date and time when automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep (for example, during an active meeting). Put X to diable this option.

DeadlineDateSoft.title: Soft Date Deadline
DeadlineDateSoft.description: If this date and time have passed, an interactive update restart dialog appears indicating that no more user deferrals are allowed. Put X to disable this option.

DeadlineDateHard.title: Hard Date Deadline
DeadlineDateHard.description: If this date has passed, the computer restarts and udpates without asking the user for approval. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutUserChoice.title: Restart or Defer Display Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserChoice.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds. The countdown of the timeout is displayed in the update restart dialog. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.title: Dialog Timeout User 'Schedule'
DialogTimeoutUserSchedule.description: Timeout in seconds for the 'Schedule' button. Put X to diable this option.

DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.title: Soft Display Timeout
DialogTimeoutSoftDeadline.description: Sets an automatic timeout for interactive update restart dialogs in seconds. The countdown of the timeout is displayed in the update restart dialog. Put X to diable this option.

DisplayIconFile.title: Display Icon
DisplayIconFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the picture to display in  notifications or dialogs. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayIconSize.title: Icon Size
DisplayIconSize.description: Number of pixels for the DisplayIcon in IBM Notifier dialogs. The value must be in between 96 and 150. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryType.title: Custom Display Accessory
DisplayAccessoryType.description: Interactive dialogs (but not notifications) generated by IBM Notifier can be easily customized via several display accessory options. The display accessory content appears below any deferral or deadline text but above any interactive item like the deferral pop-up menu or user authentication field. Put X to disable this option.

DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.title: Default Accessory
DisplayAccessoryDefaultFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the default accessory. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.title: Updates Accessory
DisplayAccessoryUpdateFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS updates. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.title: Upgrades Accessory
DisplayAccessoryUpgradeFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when performing macOS upgrades. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.title: Apple Silicon User Authentication Accessory
DisplayAccessoryUserAuthFile.description: Local path or http(s) URL to a file that is the accessory to display when Apple Silicon Macs require user authentication. Put X to reset this to default.

DisplayHelpButtonString.title: Help Button
DisplayHelpButtonString.description: Plain text to display or http(s) URL link to follow for the Help Button. Put X to disable this option.

DisplayWarningButtonString.title: Warning Button
DisplayWarningButtonString.description: Plain text or http(s) URL link to follow for the Warning Button. Put X to disable this option.

DisplaySilently.title: Display Dialogs Silently
DisplaySilently.description: When enabled, the system alert sound is suppressed when displaying dialogs.

DialogTimeoutUserAuth.title: User Authentication Timeout
DialogTimeoutUserAuth.description: On Mac computers with Apple Silicon, the number of seconds to wait for the user to successfully authenticate when presented with the user authenticated dialog. This dialog does not show a visual countdown of the timeout. Default time is 3600seconds (1 hour).

AuthMDMFailoverToUser.title: User Authentication MDM Failover
AuthMDMFailoverToUser.description: The MDM workflow can be unreliable due to its complexity, and super will automatically try again upon failure, however this settings allows super to try other options. For more information see https://github.com/Macjutsu/super/wiki/Apple-Silicon-Jamf-Pro-API-Credentials#user-authentication-mdm-failover. Put X to diable this option.

InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.title: Allow Upgrades
InstallMacOSMajorUpgrades.description: macOS now presents some Upgrades options as updates, super detects and ignores them by default (objective update over upgrade). Enabling this setting will allow the upgrades.

InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.title: Target Upgrades
InstallMacOSMajorVersionTarget.description: This setting provides a limitation on the Allow Upgrades setting, providing some management of the maximum macOS version to upgrade to.

InstallRapidSecurityResponses.title: Allow Rapid Security Response Updates
InstallRapidSecurityResponses.description: macOS 13.3+ Ventura support Rapid Security Response updates, which super will ignore if this is not enabled. super will ignore this setting on older macOS versions.

InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.title: Enforce Non-System Updates
InstallNonSystemUpdatesWithoutRestarting.description: If you don't want the super workflow to wait for a macOS update to also install non-system Apple software updates, then you can enforce those non-system updates as soon as they become available.

WorkflowOnlyDownload.title: Only Download Updates
WorkflowOnlyDownload.description: Download and prepare any available macOS updates but do not start any installation workflow. This super option is designed to work along with the --install-now option to significantly reduce the user experience wait time for user-initiated macOS update workflows.

ScheduledInstallUserChoice.title: Schedule Button Enablement
ScheduledInstallUserChoice.description: adds a 'Schedule' button to the standard deferral dialog. When clicked, this button opens a scheduled installation dialog that allows the user to select a date and time for installation. If any day or date deadlines are also specified, then the user is not allowed to select an installation date later than the soonest deadline.

ScheduledInstallDays.title: Schedule Install Days
ScheduledInstallDays.description: option allows you to specify the number of days after the zero date that a scheduled installation takes place.

ScheduledInstallReminder.title: Schedule Install Reminder Minutes
ScheduledInstallReminder.description: option allows you to specify a list of minutes separated by commas (no spaces) that define how often a scheduled installation reminder dialog appears prior to a scheduled installation.

DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.title: Test Free Space Timeout
DialogTimeoutInsufficientStorage.description: Timeout for computers with not enough free space.

DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.title: Battery Timeout
DialogTimeoutPowerRequired.description: Timeout for computers where power is required.

InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.title: Policy Triggers
InstallJamfPolicyTriggers.description: If a restart is required for system updates or forced via RestartWithoutUpdates, this list of Jamf Policy Triggers runs before any available updates install and the computer restarts.

InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.title: Install Jamf Policies Without Restarting
InstallJamfPolicyTriggersWithoutRestarti.description: allows for installation of Jamf Pro Policies even if there are no available macOS update/upgrades. Alternately you can force this workflow when also used with the --workflow-disable-update-check option. Further, this can be combined with the new --workflow-reset-super-after-completion option for a 'temporary' workflow.

WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.title: Skip Updates
WorkflowDisableUpdateCheck.description: Skip Apple software updates, even if they are available.

WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.title: Restart Without Updates
WorkflowRestartWithoutUpdates.description: Force a restart even if Apple software updates do not need it.

AuthAskUserToSavePassword.title: Ask User to Save Password
AuthAskUserToSavePassword.description: Option to save the user's password for future automatic macOS updates and upgrades.

WorkflowInstallNow.title: Ask User to Save Password
WorkflowInstallNow.description: This allows you to once again define a 'permanent' install now workflow behavior.

TestMode.title: Test Mode
TestMode.description: Mode to validate parameters, credentials, notifications, dialogs, deferrals, and deadline logic.

TestModeTimeout.title: Test Mode Timeout
TestModeTimeout.description: The amount of time in seconds to leave test notifications and dialogs open before moving on in the workflow.

VerboseMode.title: Verbose Mode
VerboseMode.description: Mode to generate additional log output.
